axis_supply.supply_status: CRITICAL - Post-Operation Crusader depletion. Extended supply lines from Tripoli (800-1000+ km) via single coastal road (Via Balbia). British naval interdiction (Malta-based RAF/RN) destroys 30-40% of Axis convoys. Fuel reserves 5-6 days (lowest of war so far), ammunition 8-9 days, water 10-15L/man/day (critical desert constraint), food 10-12 days. Rommel Papers document: 'Only 18,000 tons reached Panzer Army in March 1942 out of 60,000 ton requirement.' Supply convoy arrived 5 Jan 1942 (55 tanks, 20 armored cars, AT guns) enabled Jan counter-offensive. Supply base: Tripoli port (sole Axis lifeline). Forward supply dumps at Mersa el Brega (Jan), Benghazi recaptured 29 Jan (critical port). Q1 1942: Rebuilding phase after Crusader losses.

allied_supply.supply_status: Improved from Q4 1941. Division established in defensive positions along northern sector of Gazala Line with static supply depots. Primary supply route from Tobruk (35km) and Benghazi (250km). Water supply adequate from coastal wells and desalination. Division was 5,570 men under-strength as of 8 January 1942 (17,617 vs authorized 23,187). Supply situation stable during defensive preparations but constrained by limited port capacity at Tobruk and long haul from Egypt.
